meanings.definition: The trigonometric functions sine and cosine are cofunctions of each other.
meanings.sent1: I learned in math class that sine and cosine are cofunctions.
meanings.sent2: It is important to understand the relationship between cofunctions in trigonometry.
meanings.sent3: Why did the sine and cosine go to couples therapy? They needed to work on their cofunctions!
meanings.sent4: The friendship between sine and cosine is like a pair of cofunctions, always complementing each other.
meanings.sent5: The concept of cofunctions can be tricky, but once you get it, everything falls into place.

meanings.definition: In mathematics, the cofunction of an angle is the trigonometric function of its complement.
meanings.sent1: When studying trigonometry, understanding the concept of cofunctions is crucial.
meanings.sent2: The cofunction of an angle helps us find the trigonometric function of its complement.
meanings.sent3: Why did the angle's friends throw it a party? To celebrate its cofunction with the complement!
meanings.sent4: The relationship between an angle and its cofunction is like a dance of mathematical harmony.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing the cofunction of an angle can make trigonometry more intuitive and fun.
